summary: The 'Guarantee Utilization of All Reimbursements for Delivery of Veterans’ Health Care Act' (GUARD Veterans' Health Care Act) aims to recover costs from Medicare Advantage and prescription drug plans for healthcare services provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). It amends Title 38 of the United States Code to allow the VA to collect reimbursement from these plans. Additionally, it modifies the VA's authority to recover charges for care for non-service-connected disabilities, clarifying recovery rights and establishing new procedures for third-party compliance, including penalties for non-compliance.
